question: Which one of the following is not shared by threads?
options: ['a) program counter', 'b) stack', 'c) both program counter and stack', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) both program counter and stack

question: A process can be ___________
options: ['a) single threaded', 'b) multithreaded', 'c) both single threaded and multithreaded', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option3: c) both single threaded and multithreaded

question: If one thread opens a file with read privileges then ___________
options: ['a) other threads in the another process can also read from that file', 'b) other threads in the same process can also read from that file', 'c) any other thread can not read from that file', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) other threads in the another process can also read from that file
option2: b) other threads in the same process can also read from that file
option3: c) any other thread can not read from that file

question: The time required to create a new thread in an existing process is ___________
options: ['a) greater than the time required to create a new process', 'b) less than the time required to create a new process', 'c) equal to the time required to create a new process', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) greater than the time required to create a new process
option2: b) less than the time required to create a new process
option3: c) equal to the time required to create a new process

question: When the event for which a thread is blocked occurs?
options: ['a) thread moves to the ready queue', 'b) thread remains blocked', 'c) thread completes', 'd) a new thread is provided']
option1: a) thread moves to the ready queue
option4: d) a new thread is provided

question: The jacketing technique is used to ___________
options: ['a) convert a blocking system call into non blocking system call', 'b) create a new thread', 'c) communicate between threads', 'd) terminate a thread']
option1: a) convert a blocking system call into non blocking system call

question: Termination of the process terminates ___________
options: ['a) first thread of the process', 'b) first two threads of the process', 'c) all threads within the process', 'd) no thread within the process']
option1: a) first thread of the process
option2: b) first two threads of the process
option3: c) all threads within the process
option4: d) no thread within the process

question: Which one of the following is not a valid state of a thread?
The register context and stacks of a thread are deallocated when the thread?
Thread synchronization is required because ___________
options: ['a) all threads of a process share the same address space', 'b) all threads of a process share the same global variables', 'c) all threads of a process can share the same files', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) all threads of a process share the same address space
option2: b) all threads of a process share the same global variables
option3: c) all threads of a process can share the same files
